item.title: 保时捷与 ClearMotion 合作开发平顺悬挂技术
item.description: 德国豪华汽车制造商保时捷（Porsche）周二表示，已与 ClearMotion 合作验证这家美国初创公司的主动悬挂技术和道路读取软件，并签署了技术许可协议。【原文：German luxury automaker Porsche has partnered with ClearMotion to validate the U.S. startup's active suspension technology and road-reading software and has signed a licensing agreement for its technology, the companies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 金管局总裁称香港考虑 "深化 "与中国的部分互联互通计划
item.description: 香港金融管理局（金管局）总裁余永定（Eddie Yue）周二表示，金管局正在考虑深化香港与中国大陆之间的一些投资连接计划。【原文：Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) is considering deepening some investment connection schemes between the city and mainland China, CEO Eddie Yue said on Tuesday.】

item.title: EssilorLuxottica 收购日本 Washin 以扩大零售业务
item.description: 眼镜制造商依视路（EssilorLuxottica）周二表示，该公司已完成对日本眼镜零售商华新光学株式会社（Washin Optical Co.【原文：Eyewear maker EssilorLuxottica said on Tuesday it had completed the acquisition of Washin Optical Co., a Japanese optical retail with around 70 direct stores in the country.】

item.title: Ascend Elements 与 Elemental Strategic Metals 成立欧洲电动汽车电池回收合资企业
item.description: 美国公司 Ascend Elements 和波兰的 Elemental Strategic Metals 周二表示，双方已成立一家合资企业来回收电动汽车电池，首家波兰工厂已经开业，另一家工厂计划在德国开业。【原文：U.S. firm Ascend Elements and Poland's Elemental Strategic Metals have formed a joint venture to recycle electric vehicle batteries, with their first Polish plant already open and another plant planned in Germany, they said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道：激进投资者 Amber Capital 支持 MFE 推动 ProSieben 的变革
item.description: 该激进基金的一位高管告诉路透社，Amber Capital 将支持 ProSiebenSat.1 在本月晚些时候的股东投票中提出的战略转变，该战略转变是由德国广播公司的顶级投资者 MFE-MediaForEurope 提出的。【原文：Amber Capital will back a strategy shift at ProSiebenSat.1 put forward by the German broadcaster's top investor MFE-MediaForEurope at a shareholder vote later this month, a senior executive at the activist fund told Reuters.】

item.title: 中国 3 月汽车销量同比增长 5.7
item.description: 中国乘用车联席会周二公布的数据显示，3月份中国乘用车销量同比增长5.7%，原因是汽车制造商在旷日持久的价格战中加倍努力，以吸引全球最大汽车市场的谨慎客户。【原文：China's passenger car sales jumped 5.7% in March from a year earlier, data from the China Passenger Car Association showed on Tuesday, as automakers doubled down in a protracted price war to woo cautious customers in the world's largest auto market.】

item.title: 欧元区银行降低抵押贷款门槛，但需求持续下降 - 欧洲央行
item.description: 欧洲中央银行周二的一项调查显示，欧元区银行上一季度降低了抵押贷款审批标准，这是两年多来的首次，但在借贷成本高企和经济停滞不前的情况下，信贷需求仍在下降。【原文：Euro zone banks lowered the bar on mortgage approvals last quarter for the first time in over two years but demand for credit kept falling amid high borrowing costs and a stagnant economy, a European Central bank survey showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称贝恩资本出售 Axis Bank 股份，融资 4.29 亿美元
item.description: 据一位直接知情人士透露，贝恩资本以每股 1071 卢比（12.87 美元）的价格出售了其持有的 Axis Bank 股份，以筹集 4.29 亿美元。【原文：Bain Capital has sold its Axis Bank stake at 1,071 rupees ($12.87) per share to raise $429 million, according to a source with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，中国工商银行计划出售 55 亿美元的减亏债券
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，中国工商银行计划最快于本月发行高达 400 亿元人民币（55 亿美元）的总损失吸收能力（TLAC）债券。【原文：Industrial and Commercial Bank of China is planning to issue as much as 40 billion yuan ($5.5 billion) of total loss-absorbing capacity (TLAC) bonds as soon as this month, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 物价风险挥之不去，新加坡将维持货币政策不变
item.description: 人们普遍预计，新加坡央行本月将维持货币政策不变，在通胀开始明显缓解之前不会放宽货币政策。【原文：Singapore's central bank is widely expected to keep its monetary policy unchanged this month and hold off from easing its settings until inflation starts to ease significantly.】

item.title: 消息人士称，由美国投资者贝克和贝兹组成的财团将收购德国零售巨头 Galeria
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士周二告诉路透社，包括哈德逊湾公司首席执行官理查德-贝克（Richard Baker）的投资公司 NRDC Corp 在内的一个财团将收购德国连锁百货公司 Galeria。【原文：A consortium including Hudson Bay Company CEO Richard Baker's investment firm NRDC Corp is set to take over German department store chain Galeria, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉前首席执行官埃伯哈德称公司取消低成本汽车计划是 "耻辱
item.description: 特斯拉公司创始人兼前首席执行官马丁-艾伯哈德（Martin Eberhard）周二表示，在中国市场的激烈竞争中，特斯拉公司取消了其低成本汽车计划，他对此表示 "遗憾"。【原文：A Tesla Inc founder and former chief executive, Martin Eberhard, said on Tuesday it was a "shame" to hear that the company was scrapping its low-cost car plans amid fierce competition in China.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称拜登和岸田可能讨论得克萨斯州子弹头列车项目
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）正在寻求恢复人们对利用日本子弹头列车在美国建造第一条高速铁路计划的兴趣，消息人士称他本周可能会在华盛顿与日本首相讨论该项目。【原文：President Joe Biden is seeking to revive interest in a plan to build the first high-speed rail in the U. S. using Japanese bullet trains, with sources saying he is likely to discuss the project with Japan's prime minister in Washington this week.】

item.title: 马来西亚报告限制社交媒体内容的请求增加
item.description: 马来西亚政府周二表示，今年有害社交媒体内容急剧增加，马来西亚敦促 Facebook 运营商 Meta 和短视频服务 TikTok 加强对其平台的监控。【原文：Malaysia urged Facebook operator Meta and short video service TikTok to step up monitoring on their platforms, it said on Tuesday, with the government reporting sharp increases in harmful social media content this year.】

item.title: 亚马逊在欧洲新兴在线市场争夺战中进军视频领域
item.description: 亚马逊和 Temu 正采取不同的策略来挑战波兰在线市场的领头羊 Allegro，美国电子商务巨头将重点放在视频领域，而这家以时尚为重点的中国公司则依靠低价来赢得客户。【原文：Amazon and Temu are taking different tacks to challenge Poland's online marketplace leader Allegro , with the U.S. e-commerce giant leaning into video and the fashion-focused Chinese company relying on low prices to win customers.】

item.title: 大选云集的 2024 年将如何影响世界市场？
item.description: 在大选纷至沓来的一年里，市场迄今为止都对选举结果置之不理，而将焦点集中在一场可能会对从国际贸易到新兴市场债务等所有方面产生影响的竞争上：11 月份的美国总统大选。【原文：In an election-packed year, markets have so far shrugged off results, with the focus squarely on the one contest that could reverberate across everything from international trade to emerging market debt: the United States presidential race in November.】

item.title: 波音危机：空中爆炸如何危及 2021 年的司法部坠机协议
item.description: 美国当局正面临着两起致命波音 737 MAX 飞机坠毁事故遇难者家属的新压力，他们要求对这家航空航天公司提起刑事诉讼，因为 1 月份发生的空中爆炸事故暴露了持续存在的安全问题。【原文：U.S. authorities are facing fresh pressure from families of the victims of two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes to criminally prosecute the aerospace company following a January mid-air blowout that exposed ongoing safety issues.】

item.title: 夏季旅行人数将创历史新高，航空公司因飞机不足而举步维艰
item.description: 全球航空业正面临夏季挤压，预计旅行需求将超过大流行前的水平，而由于波音和空中客车公司的生产问题，飞机交付量急剧下降......。【原文：The global airline industry is facing a summer squeeze, with travel demand expected to surpass pre-pandemic levels while aircraft deliveries drop sharply due to production problems at Boeing and Airbus .】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，通用汽车 Cruise 将在亚利桑那州凤凰城恢复机器人出租车测试
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，通用汽车公司的自动驾驶汽车部门 Cruise 正准备在亚利桑那州凤凰城恢复对其机器人轴与安全驾驶员的测试。【原文：Cruise, General Motors' self-driving car unit, is preparing to resume testing its robotaxis with safety drivers in Phoenix, Arizona, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价金属在喧嚣中崛起
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 汇丰银行将向加利西亚出售阿根廷业务，交易金额达 5.5 亿美元
item.description: 汇丰控股（HSBC Holdings）周二表示，将把阿根廷业务出售给该国最大的私营金融集团加利西亚金融集团（Grupo Financiero Galicia），交易价值为 5.5 亿美元。【原文：HSBC Holdings , said on Tuesday that it will sell its Argentina business to Grupo Financiero Galicia, the country's largest private financial group, in a deal valued at $550 million.】

item.title: 日本央行行长上田表示，日本央行预计货币条件将保持宽松
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫周二表示，央行预计宽松的货币条件将暂时持续下去。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said on Tuesday the central bank expects accommodative monetary conditions to continue for the time being.】

item.title: 中国不确定性为奢侈品行业前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 在奢侈品公司公布第一季度业绩时，投资者担心奢侈品销售会急剧放缓，这反映出中国需求疲软，而且与去年相比，去年中国大陆取消了对加征增值税的限制，促进了销售。【原文：Investors are bracing for a steep slowdown in luxury sales when luxury companies report their first quarter results, reflecting lacklustre Chinese demand and comparisons with last year when the lifting of COVID curbs in mainland China boosted sales.】

item.title: 亚洲股市上涨；制造业利好金属飞扬
item.description: 周二，工业金属价格在全球制造业反弹的预期下延续涨势，而亚洲股市在本周美国通胀数据和欧洲央行重要会议前则略显谨慎地悄然上涨。【原文：Industrial metals prices extended their gains on Tuesday with expectations of a worldwide manufacturing rebound, while Asian shares crept up a little more cautiously ahead of this week's U.S. inflation data and a crucial European Central Bank meeting.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Blackstone 接近达成欧舒丹私有化交易
item.description: 彭博新闻社周二援引熟悉此事的人士的话报道称，Blackstone Inc 接近达成对在香港上市的护肤品公司欧舒丹国际有限公司（L'Occitane International SA）的私有化交易。【原文：Blackstone Inc is nearing a take-private deal for Hong Kong-listed skincare company L'Occitane International SA , Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 3 月份企业经营状况稳定，价格压力减轻
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，澳大利亚3月份的商业状况变化不大，销售和就业在十年高利率的情况下保持稳定，而价格压力则从高位略有缓解。【原文：Australian business conditions were little changed in March as sales and employment held steady in the face of decade-high interest rates, a survey showed on Tuesday, while price pressures eased slightly from elevated levels.】

item.title: 美国国债收益率攀升，日元感受热度
item.description: 周二，美元走势不稳，因为它未能从美国国债收益率的上升中获得有意义的提振，尽管这对日元造成了压力，日元在数十年低点附近徘徊，并使交易商对任何干预迹象保持警惕。【原文：The dollar was tentative on Tuesday as it failed to get a meaningful boost from a rise in U.S. Treasury yields, though that kept pressure on the yen which languished near multi-decade lows and left traders on alert for any signs of intervention.】

item.title: 中东停火希望减弱，油价转而走高
item.description: 在以色列和哈马斯之间的谈判将导致加沙停火并缓解中东紧张局势的希望减弱之后，油价在亚洲早盘交易中上涨。【原文：Oil prices rose in early Asian trading after hopes diminished that negotiations between Israel and Hamas would lead to a ceasefire in Gaza and ease tension in the Middle East.】

item.title: 韩国央行本季度将维持现状，下半年削减 50 个基点：路透调查
item.description: 路透社对经济学家进行的一项调查显示，韩国央行将在周五的会议上连续第10次维持其关键政策利率不变，但由于通胀仍然高企，预计下一季度将开始一个较浅的降息周期。【原文：The Bank of Korea will keep its key policy rate unchanged for a 10th straight meeting on Friday but was expected to embark on a shallow cutting cycle next quarter as inflation remains elevated, a Reuters poll of economists found.】

item.title: 美国财政部阿德耶莫警告 "恶意 "行为者正在使用虚拟资产
item.description: 美国财政部副部长瓦利-阿德耶莫（Wally Adeyemo）周一表示，除非国会批准新的监管工具，否则美国财政部担心恐怖组织会增加对虚拟货币和其他数字资产的使用。【原文：The U.S. Treasury Department fears terrorist groups will increase their use of virtual currencies and other digital assets unless Congress approves new regulatory tools, Deputy Secretary Wally Adeyemo said on Monday.】
